text: Florence Arthaud (28 October 1957 â€“ 9 March 2015) was a French sailor. She was from Boulogne-Billancourt. In 1990 Arthaud established a new world record for the fastest solo crossing of the North Atlantic, beating the previous record by two days. In 2015, Arthaud took part in Dropped, a reality television show on TF1 in which sportspeople were transported by helicopters into the wilderness. During filming on 9 March 2015, she died in the Villa Castelli helicopter crash in Argentina along with nine other people, two of whom were fellow contestants. ==References== Category:1957 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Aviation deaths Category:Sportspeople from Boulogne-Billancourt Category:Sailors
title: Florence Arthaud
